entry.title: bitcoinj 0.11 released, with p2sh, bip39 and payment protocol support
entry.summary: The provided context is related to digital signatures and encryption in the Bitcoin community. Mike Hearn released bitcoinj 0.11 with issues that included a truncated Git commit hash and incomplete PGP fingerprint. Several people contacted him with solutions, including Peter Todd who wrote summaries of the solutions offered. Todd explained that the truncated Git commit hash can be exploited by attackers using partial pre-image attacks, and an attacker can modify the bitcoinj source code to generate private keys insecurely and ensure that the last 48 bits of the commit hash match Hearn's message. Another issue was the omission of the key fingerprint, making it difficult for users to verify its authenticity.The moral of the story is that if a second-pre-image attack is a threat, then at least 128 bits should be used.
